intro: Lomaria andina, commonly known as Andean lomaria, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Lomaria andina thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
